title: Last weeks momentum sustained in early trade
text:
Robert Guy

US-based Prologis has lobbed a $US12.6 billion bid for Liberty, with the deal underscoring the value of warehouse assets.

The acquisition will add a 107 million square foot logistics portfolio and 5.1 million square feet of logistics development in progress.

The all-cash deal will see Prologis sell $US3.5 billion ($5.13 billion) of assets it views as non-strategic.

The deal underscores the value of warehouse and logistics assets, with Australia's Goodman Group offering exposure to fast growing e-commerce companies.

Goodman counts Amazon, Deutsche Post, AP Moller-Maersk and Japan Post as its biggest clients. Goodman shares are up 35 per cent this year.
description: ASX off to another positive start, Carbonxt trade halted, another $150m raise for Virgin, Worley into the Euro wind energy market
